title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze and ASD give error on Sensor-current(IDOR)--DC In (test1) ERROR- Sensor is reading below the low limit

title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: That sensor is likely because you didn’t have the charger plugged in. Which board is this 3332 3662 3787 or 2015?

title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: Is that sensor on I/O power board ?

title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: Need board model! A sensor will not cause freezes. I bet this is a 3662 or 3787.....

title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: Make sure your LCD is good. Seen a ton of these gen1 A1398 units that had bad LCD panels that mimicked a hard system freeze (cursor freezes, etc). Sometimes it would be from motion/movement of the display, other times it seemed to be random. Tricked a ton of our retail customers (would "swear" it's a board issue, but it was a panel failing). Won't necessarily have any sort of display anomaly (lines or weird colors or anything) or trip AHT/ASD failure, etc.

title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: Dont have another screen to test but screen itself looks ok

title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: Solved ,someone was reflow memory and knock out one capacitor

title: Macbook Pro 15 A1398 sometimes freeze
message: They reflowed the RAM because it was freezing. One decoupling cap will usually not matter at all. Which cap was it?
